TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FilterableAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class FilterableAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class FilterableAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the property to which the attribute is applied supports device filtering. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute is applied to a property to specify whether the property supports device filtering. When a property supports device filtering, you can override the value of a property for a specific device by specifying a device filter. By default, properties are filterable, so a control developer could prevent device filtering on a property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute to `false`. For more information, see [Customizing for Specific Devices](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a7f55dfa-290b-45f8-bf8f-d5a4540bae61).
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/docs/standard/attributes/index.md).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to apply a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute to a property of a custom control to indicate that the property does not support device filtering.
[!code-csharp[FilterableAttribute_2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/FilterableAttribute_2/CS/simplecustomcontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FilterableAttribute_2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/FilterableAttribute_2/VB/simplecustomcontrol.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class. The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Filterable%2A>|The value of the `filterable` parameter.|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to apply a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute to a property of a custom control. This constructor is called internally by ASP.NET to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object that represents the attribute.
[!code-csharp[FilterableAttribute_2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/FilterableAttribute_2/CS/simplecustomcontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FilterableAttribute_2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/FilterableAttribute_2/VB/simplecustomcontrol.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute Default
Public Shared ReadOnly Default As FilterableAttribute

Docs.summary: Represents a predefined object with default property settings. This field is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Default> field represents a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object with default property settings. This field is often used when comparing a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object to the predefined object.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Default> field is identical to the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Yes> field.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Equals (obj As Object) As Boolean

Docs.param: The to compare with this instance.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current instance of the class is equal to the specified object.
Docs.returns: if the object contained in the parameter is equal to the current instance of the object; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Equals%2A> method to determine whether the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class is equal to the specified object. For the objects to be equal, they must meet the following criteria:
1. The object contained in the `obj` parameter must be a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
2. The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Filterable%2A> property of both objects must be equal.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used primarily by control developers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Filterable%2A> property to determine whether the property to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute is applied supports device filtering. When a property supports device filtering, you can override the value of a property for a specific device by specifying a device filter. For more information, see [Customizing for Specific Devices](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a7f55dfa-290b-45f8-bf8f-d5a4540bae61).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to apply a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute to a property of a custom control to indicate that the property does not support device filtering.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.IsDefaultAttribute%2A> method is a helper method used by ASP.NET to determine whether the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class is equal to the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Default> field.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsObjectFilterable(object instance) cil managed
Public Shared Function IsObjectFilterable (instance As Object) As Boolean

Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified supports device filtering.
Docs.returns: if the contained in the parameter supports device filtering; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.IsObjectFilterable%2A> method to determine whether the specified <xref:System.Object> supports device filtering.
> [!NOTE] > An object supports device filtering if its data type supports device filtering. For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.IsTypeFilterable%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsPropertyFilterable(class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor propertyDescriptor) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the properties of the property to test.
Docs.summary: Determines whether a property supports device filtering.
Docs.returns: if the property represented by the object contained in the parameter supports device filtering; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.IsPropertyFilterable%2A> method to determine whether a property supports device filtering. To use this method, you must pass in a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object that contains the properties of the property to test.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsTypeFilterable(class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the data type to test.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified data type supports device filtering.
Docs.returns: if the data type contained in the parameter supports device filtering; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.IsTypeFilterable%2A> method to determine whether the specified type supports device filtering. A type supports device filtering if it has a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute applied to it.

Public Shared ReadOnly No As FilterableAttribute

Docs.summary: Represents a predefined object that indicates that a property does not support device filtering. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.No> field represents a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object that indicates that a property does not support device filtering. This field is often used when comparing a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object to the predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute Yes
Public Shared ReadOnly Yes As FilterableAttribute

Docs.summary: Represents a predefined object that indicates that a property supports device filtering. This field is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Yes> field represents a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object that indicates that a property supports device filtering. This field is often used when comparing a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object to the predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
> [!NOTE] > This is the default <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
